description: A sport in which competitors aim to shoot arrows at a target from a set distance.
A discipline of gymnastics where athletes perform short routines on different apparatus.
A sport that combines swimming, dance, and gymnastics, performed in water.
A collection of sporting events that involve competitive running, jumping, throwing, and walking.
A combat sport in which two people throw punches at each other for a predetermined amount of time.
A style of street dance that originated as part of hip-hop culture, characterized by its acrobatic and athletic moves, including spins, flips, and intricate footwork.
A timed event where athletes navigate a canoe or kayak through a course of hanging gates on river rapids.
A competitive race held on a calm water course where athletes paddle a canoe or kayak to achieve the fastest time.
A team sport where two teams of seven players each pass a ball to throw it into the goal of the other team.
A team sport played on grass or artificial turf, where players use sticks to hit a ball into the opposing team's goal.
A modern martial art and combat sport that originated in Japan, focusing on techniques such as throws and grappling to defeat opponents.
A grueling long-distance swimming competition held in open water, testing athletes' endurance and strength over extended distances.
An Olympic sport that comprises five different events: fencing, freestyle swimming, equestrian show jumping, and a final combined event of pistol shooting and cross country running.
A sport in which individuals or groups of five manipulate one or two pieces of apparatus: clubs, hoop, ball, ribbon, and rope.
An action sport which involves riding and performing tricks using a skateboard.
A form of rock climbing that relies on permanent anchors fixed to the rock for protection.
A water sport in which the wave rider, referred to as a surfer, rides on the forward or deep face of a moving wave.
An individual or team racing sport that requires the use of one's entire body to move through water.
A sport in which two or four players hit a lightweight ball back and forth across a table using small rackets.
A Korean martial art characterized by its emphasis on head-height kicks, jumping and spinning kicks, and fast kicking techniques.
A racket sport that can be played individually against a single opponent or between two teams of two players each.
A sport where athletes perform acrobatics while bouncing on a trampoline.
A multisport race with three continuous and sequential endurance races, typically swimming, cycling, and running.
A team sport in which two teams of six players are separated by a net, and each team tries to score points by grounding a ball on the other team's court.
A competitive team sport played in water between two teams of seven players each.
A sport in which the athlete attempts a maximum-weight single lift of a barbell loaded with weight plates.
A combat sport involving grappling-type techniques such as clinch fighting, throws and takedowns, joint locks, pins, and other grappling holds.
